title: ICE: return_position_impl_trait_in_trait + -Zlower-impl-trait-in-trait-to-assoc-ty

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(return_position_impl_trait_in_trait)] trait Foo { fn bar(x: bool) -> impl Sized { if x { let _: u32 = Self::bar(!x); } Default::default() } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.69.0-nightly (44cfafe2f 2023-03-03) binary: rustc commit-hash: 44cfafe2fafe816395d3acc434663a45d5178c41 commit-date: 2023-03-03 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.69.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` ### Error output rustc -Zlower-impl-trait-in-trait-to-assoc-ty --edition=2018 --crate-type lib file.rs ``` feature is unstable bla ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/context.rs:2438:55 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f005cd66afa - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::libunwind::trace::h03465bf7db0a5bcb at /rustc/44cfafe2fafe816395d3acc434663a45d5178c41/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:93:5 1: 0x7f005cd66afa -
